title: BBC Local Live: Channel Islands on Thursday 24 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: ana rebelo murder : man , 25 , released from police bail .
charity urges islanders to 'think carefully ' about dating apps .
capital themed float takes big prize at north show .
volunteers work to clean 40 swastikas off war bunkers .
retail firm says 'brexit partly to blame ' for closure and laying off 25 people .
education plans for future role of grant-aided colleges 'lack clarity ' .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: our coverage across the channel islands has finished for the day .
we 'll be back on friday from 08:00 with the latest news , weather , travel and sport .
do n't forget bbc channel islands news on bbc one at 18:30 and 22:30 .

documents.title: fewer islanders prescribed antibiotics
text: fewer islanders are being prescribed antibiotics in the community in guernsey and alderney , according to the states .
in 2016 , 8,000 fewer prescriptions were given out than in 2011 , a fall of 12 % , a spokesman said .
adding , the use of the most `` potent '' antibiotics had halved .
the states says the reduction was important to combat antibiotic resistant organisms in individuals and the community .
only prescribing antibiotics where they are truly appropriate has been a priority on the islands for several years .
this considerable fall in the prescribing is great news and i would like to thank our doctors for their efforts . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey battle of flowers : the winner is
text: london sights is the winner of the biggest category of float at this year 's north show .
the entry , by the torode , ogier , de garis and naftel families was inspired by some of london 's famous landmarks .
it pipped the jee family 's mr men float to the class t title , which is a float of paper flowers , on a decorated trailer longer than 20ft .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: states grant £ 20k funding to expand go-kart track
text: the states of jersey has helped a private company fund an expansion to its go-kart track at sorel point .
£ 20,000 was given to jersey kart and motor club to support the development .
constable steve pallett signed off on the decision , which was approved on the grounds it was part of plans to `` increase visitor numbers '' .
in 1994 the club was forcibly moved from its former facilities at belle vue , st brelade because of a compulsory purchase order from the states , which turned the site into housing .
the states said the new investment `` discharged '' them from previous commitments to the company .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: students warned to check bus passes for expiry - or face full fare
text: with the start of a new academic year looming , liberty bus in jersey is asking students to make sure their avanchicards have not expired , or face paying the £ 2 full price fare .
students must present their valid card to get 77p student bus tickets .
cards will expire for those who may have left school after gcses .
the company has also warned long queues are expected to buy passes ready for the new school year in the last week of the school holidays .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: lgbt+ charity seeks to hold regular community events
text: an lgbt+ charity wants to form a new association to hold regular community events in both jersey and guernsey .
liberate says it has become `` increasingly difficult '' for lgbt+ people to come together for various reasons , including the decline of the `` gay bar '' business model .
the idea of the new association called out is to hold a weekly evening meeting , with a different activity on each occasion .
vic tanner davy , chief executive officer of liberate , says he is currently looking to see if the community is interested .

we hope that out will provide a space that recognises that lgbt+ people have other interests , just like everyone else , and that we deserve to have a publicly visible association that enables us to contribute to society , as other sections of society do . ''
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey battle of flowers : final floats
text: the final , and biggest floats have just been paraded around the show ground .
the first , a tribute to children 's books the mr men , the second a family 's tribute to london after a recent visit .
we 'll find out the winners shortly .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: foundations ' funding for youth commission
text: the youth commission for guernsey and alderney has received a three-year funding commitment from the ana leaf foundation and lloyds bank foundation for the channel islands .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: weather : bright and warm day ahead
text: friday will be dry , bright and warm , though the skies are likely to cloud over at times .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) for guernsey and 21c ( 70f ) for jersey .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: asian hornet sighted at north show
text: this one is made out of flowers , though .
it 's part of `` guernsey tom '' a tribute to the island 's tomato growing heritage .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show : meet clara
text: she 's a wooden cow , and with the right tender touch you can milk her .
it 's amazing how many people young and in my case , old , who want to have a go .
i 'm not sure if i 've quite mastered it though .
i hope real ones are n't this difficult .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show : crown and anchor , a 'mug 's game ? '
text: a firm favourite at any of guernsey 's agricultural shows is the dice game crown and anchor .
the tables were heaving here last night , i 'm told , as people gambled away hoping to make a few quid .
the game was traditionally played by british sailors and is popular in the channel islands .
in the short time i 've watched there 's only been one winner here , the banker .
`` it 's a mug 's game '' , he tells me .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show : guerns 'are fire eaters '
text: guernsey folk can often be described as a fiery lot , and apparently we 're not shy of the hot stuff either .
chilli growers rick and nong creber tell me their locally made sauces go down well , particularly `` medium '' ones , which i can assure you had me gasping for a pint of milk .
they grow a number of different varieties , nearly year round , but the really hot ones only grow in peak season .
`` they are fire eaters , '' says nong , who moved to the island from thailand .
`` i think a lot of people can eat hot .
we 've got our regulars . ''
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: teenager injured while tombstoning
text: the teenager suffered an ankle injury by catching their feet on a ledge after jumping from the k2 rock on guernsey 's west coast .
paramedics had attended to the teenager , the joint emergency services control centre said .
author: James Rabey
BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: broken down vehicle causing traffic to back up
text: a broken down vehicle with a trailer is causing delays in rue poudreuse , st martin , say guernsey police .
it has stopped near the junction that leads to catherine best 's mill .
officers are urging motorists to avoid the area .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : late sunshine and a clear night
text: any cloud will break up during the evening to give some late sunshine and a good chance of another spectacular sunset .
a dry and mainly clear night will follow .
in jersey :
and in guernsey :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: guernsey north show : children 's floats in the arena
text: guernsey north show : children 's floats in the arena
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey battle of flowers : how does it work ?
text: as the decorated wheelbarrows do the rounds at the show ground there are lots of people around me scribbling down .
they 're watching , eagle-eyed , at every entry and giving their favourite in each category with the help of some added information from the announcer .
the entries are being collected by volunteers , with the winners due to be announced later .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show : red barrows on display
text: while there will be no red arrows for the guernsey air display this year the island 's affection for the royal air force 's display team is clear .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show : on yer bikes
text: there are more than 30 bicycles jazzed up with flowers being displayed at the north show this afternoon - we 've got some nods to bake off , someone you 're gon na call , mr men , and various animals .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: the north 's finest fancy dress ?
text: before the floats come out it is the fancy dress competition for island children , and a handful of enthusiastic adults , at the north show .
the floats are on the way shortly .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: thinking about what to do after your gcses ?
text: it 's a nerve-wracking time of year for many teenagers who may be up their gcse results today .
the states of jersey has information on their website to help young people decide what to do after getting their results , including further education , getting a job and employment schemes .
we have lots of employment schemes to help you find work after your gcses
if you want to go into a full-time job after your gcses , we 've got plenty of tips to help you land the job
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show 's monster pumpkin
text: there are no prizes for guessing what the biggest draw in the north show 's exhibition tent is .
this monster pumpkin won a first prize for grower matthew lane , who by recollection , had a similar winning whopper last year .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey 's battle of flowers under way
text: guernsey 's battle of flowers under way
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: pickaxe 'used to smash window at garden centre '
text: police say a was used to smash a glass window at a garden centre in guernsey .
it happened between 17:00 on sunday and 07:50 on monday at le friquet garden centre , castel .
police are appealing for information or anyone in the area `` who is missing a
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: complaints against drone operators 'rising '
text: police received 28 complaints against drone operators in jersey between january 2014 and august 2017 , a freedom of information request has revealed - with the number of complaints rising year on year .
so far there have been 13 complaints in 2017 , the largest number of complaints in the period covered by the data .
2016 saw 12 complaints , a sharp rise on 2015 , where only two complaints were made , and one in 2014 .
the states said where pilots were identified `` words of advice '' were given .
this has happened to 14 people as a result of a complaint .
there are restrictions in place in jersey as to where you can fly drones , the drone code can be found here .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show : local produce galore
text: there 's plenty of local produce on display at the north show , including these chilies .
they 've been grown by couple rick and nong creber .

rick , the son of a guernsey grower , and nong , who moved here from thailand 14 years ago sell a selection of sauces made from chilies grown in their greenhouse in the north of the island , near beaucette marina .
they 've been doing the part-time venture for three years .
they grow a number of different varieties , nearly year-round , but the really hot ones only grow in peak season .
`` i 've got some habaneros nearly 8ft high at the moment , '' says rick .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: north show bus vibe
text: i have never actually stepped aboard one of guernsey 's new streetvibe buses so this is actually a fairly exciting moment .
visitors to the north show can have a look inside and speak to staff .
this one will be off at 18:00 to run a specialist service to and from the show .
ct plus operations manager lee murphy was on hand to talk me through the new bus , and a book which is designed to steer youngsters towards travelling independently on the island 's service .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: swastikas 'protected ' by canadian town
text: volunteers are currently removing swastikas sprayed on nazi world war two bunkers in jersey .
however , across the atlantic in canada , the mayor of pointe-des-cascades in quebec has stopped a man from painting over swastikas on an anchor in a public car park .
corey fleischer , who goes around montreal removing hateful graffiti , tried to paint over the swastikas .
but the mayor stopped him and had police remove him from the park , arguing the anchor is a part of local history .
back home in jersey , the latest swastika graffiti attack on nazi bunkers is the second in two months , and has been described as `` very offensive '' by the channel islands occupation society .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'warro ' from the north show
text: that 's hello , in guernsey french .
hundreds of islanders are enjoying the sunshine at this agricultural show , the last of the summer .
the crowds are currently enjoying the mighty smith , a chap who just balanced a young girl sat on a chair on his head .
as if that ca n't be topped , the highlight for many comes later with the battle of flowers .
it 's not quite as big as jersey 's but it 's not all about size , i 'm told .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: nhs 'will implode ' says new guernsey paediatrician
text: a new guernsey doctor has painted a bleak of the nhs in the uk .
i 'm very fond of the nhs , i 've worked in it for 20 years , but there are problems .
we were working longer and longer hours , we were working later hours , so every five days i was working up until 22:00 .
i did n't start my job wanting to work nights and late shifts .
i wanted to spend more time with my family i suppose .
i think the nhs is going to implode if i 'm quite honest , currently there 's not enough money for people 's expectations .
something is going to change dramatically in the next couple of years and i thought , well , why not get out now ?
she started her role this week as a paediatrician .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: park safety : road to close for one-year trial
text: a potentially dangerous road used by dozens of children each day will be closed to cars for a one-year trial aimed at improving road safety around the millennium town park .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: jersey amateur cyclists to compete in world championships
text: more than a dozen amateur cyclists from jersey will compete in the uci grand fondo world champions in france this weekend .
they will take on the 155km road race in albi on sunday against cyclists from as far afield as austrailia and malaysia .
the jersey contingent is made up of cyclists competing for great britain and poland .
cycle club jersey rouleurs are sending 14 cyclists and ian williams , who runs the club , said he expects it to be a `` tough weekend '' .
everybody is up for it .
we 've got a lot of different age groups and dynamics as well .
john for instance is in the age group 55-60 , but still rides like a 20-year-old .
then we 've got steve , who qualified for the fastest category , he 's down in the 30-34 age range , and that we know is going to be fast because it 's full of ex-professionals .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: airbnb rules in guernsey 'outdated '
text: the leader of a community project in guernsey has thrown into question the island 's rules regarding airbnb and other peer-to-peer accommodation sites .
under the 1948-98 tourist ( guernsey ) laws all private dwellings housing paid visitors must have an annual boarding permit , issued by the states of guernsey .
but marc winn , founder of the community movement , the dandelion project , feels the rules are `` outdated '' and were `` designed before the internet '' .
this week the states said there was an 8.3 % rise in the number of leisure visitors staying in guernsey , partly due to the growing popularity of sites like airbnb .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: breakingana rebelo murder : man , 25 , released from police bail
text: a 25-year-old man who was arrested in may on sus of the murder of 51-year-old ana rebelo in st helier , has been released from police bail with no further action , the states of jersey police have said .
officers said a 58-year-old man , who was also arrested in connection with the murder investigation , remains on police bail .
five months after ms rebelo 's body was found , police said both men had returned for `` further interviews '' , resulting in the release .
a spokeswoman said : `` we continue working closely with the law officers department ( lod ) .
we are preparing a file for consideration by the lod and a decision is not expected for a couple of months . ''
the lod bring cases to court on behalf of the states of jersey .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: gcse celebrations in guernsey schools
text: students at les beaucamps celebrating gcse results .
73 % of pupils achieved a-c in english , 62 % a-c in maths .
42 % of students at la mare de carteret attained 5 gcse grades a-c and an `` unheralded number '' of a -b grades .
les beaucamps headteacher says overall gcse results are slightly down , by 5 % , but is pleased with very good results in english and maths .
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: scaffolding to come down at corbiere lighthouse
text: scaffolding is expected to be taken down from corbiere lighthouse next week .
it should be 10 years before more restoration work is needed at the local landmark , ports of jersey has said .
the work has involved cleaning off old paint , resealing the concrete and repairing the walkway at the top , before painting it white again .
peter snell from the department for infrastructure says some people have been disappointed the iconic structure has been hidden from view at the height of the tourist season .
but ports of jersey say the good weather over the summer period was the ideal time to complete the work .
author: Cameron Ward
BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: 'brexit partly to blame ' for food wholesaler closing
text: brexit is partly to blame for phoenix foods in guernsey having to close , with 25 people set to lose their jobs , according to directors .
the firm will not be renewing its lease at the old guernsey tobacco factory and will stop trading on 30 september , the food wholesaler announced on wednesday .
the company has decided not to extend it and commercial director , martina mcgibney , says the `` current economic climate '' has made conditions hard for the business .
for us it 's the skill set .
also , in wholesale , the margins are getting tighter , and with the impeding news from brexit , the costs and inflation rates of our products are continuing to go up . ''
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: guernsey 's north show : what 's on ?
text: guernsey 's north show : what 's on ?
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: education proposals for grant-aided colleges 'a mathematical calculation '
text: the states education committee has produced the `` minimum '' amount of information from which to base a proposal for the future of grant-aided colleges , according to deputy gavin st pier .
the committee has put forward plans to cut states funding to three colleges currently receiving grants , which are due to be debated in september .
guernsey 's most senior politician , and president of the policy and resources committee says it is not possible to assess whether the proposed funding arrangements are `` appropriate '' .
deputy @ twitterid says the education cttee has produced the bare minimum in its plans for the future of grant aided colleges here
author: BBC Radio Guernsey

documents.title: burst water main affects 16 properties , castel
text: we are currently attending to a burst water main in rue de la lande , castel affecting 16 properties in the area .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: guernsey 's north show : let battle commence
text: guernsey 's battle of flowers takes place this afternoon on the second day of the north show .
spectators can go along and take a look this afternoon from 14:30 , when the floats are first paraded , with the awards given after 17:00 .
the floats will be competing for the coveted prix d'honneur '' .
at 21:00 the evening culminates in the illuminated cavalcade and firework display .
author: Rob Byrne
BBC News Online

documents.title: foundations ' funding for youth commission
text: the youth commission for guernsey and alderney has received a three-year funding commitment from the ana leaf foundation and lloyds bank foundation for the channel islands .
author: Guernsey Press

documents.title: charity urges islanders to 'think carefully ' about dating apps
text: a jersey rape charity is urging islanders to think `` carefully '' about using dating apps .
jersey action against rape says it has had calls from people who have found themselves in difficult situations after meeting someone they have spoken to online .
sarah mcintosh , from the charity , says the apps seem to be more about `` hooking up '' than actually dating .
she added , although people may chat online , users may not actually know the person they are meeting up with as well as they think .
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: dry and bright today
text: it looks to be dry and bright in the channel islands today , with some light winds forecast .
there should be plenty of sunshine for the north show , though some fair weather cloud will pop up from time to time .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
in jersey :
and in guernsey :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pupils to up gcse results across channel islands
text: teenagers across the channel islands will receive their gcse results this morning .
in england and wales some students have been sitting new exams , with results given in a numerical grading system .
instead of the a-u gcse grades , the english , english literature and maths exams are graded nine , being the highest , to one , being the lowest in an o-level style system .
the percentage of passes will be kept the same as under the old system , in the interest of fairness .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'very few responses ' to future hospital inquiry
text: an independent inspector reviewing the planning application for the island 's new hospital has received `` very few '' responses in the month since a public inquiry into the proposals was launched .
author: Jersey Evening Post

documents.title: swastikas removed from ww2 bunkers
text: volunteers have been cleaning world war two bunkers that were sprayed with about 40 swastikas .
the offensive symbol was daubed on the old german fortifications using black and gold spray paint at some point over the last week , jersey police said .
the bunkers , which attract many tourists , are due to be opened for the upcoming holiday weekend .
it is the latest in a spate of vandalism at war bunkers across the island .

colin isherwood , the president of the channel islands occupation society , says whilst it is being taken seriously by the authorities , there is not much the group can do to stop it happening in the first place .
states of jersey police are investigating .
author: BBC Radio Jersey

documents.title: education proposals 'lack clarity ' for grant-aided colleges
text: proposals for the future role of the grant-aided colleges in guernsey `` lack clarity '' , according to the states most senior committee .

proposals to reduce the funding for the three fee paying colleges , from £ 4.4m to just under £ 1m per year over the next seven years , have been put forward by the committee responsible for education .
but the policy and resources committee say it is not possible to assess whether the proposed funding arrangements are `` appropriate '' .

in a letter on the proposals , president of the committee , deputy gavin st pier , said there was an inherent risk to the financial viability of blanchelande , elizabeth and ladies colleges if it does not prove possible for them to replace grant funded students with fee-paying students .
author: Simon Fairclough
Guernsey Political Reporter

documents.title: local live across the channel islands
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live across the channel islands .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather throughout the day , as well as live updates from guernsey 's north show and battle of flowers .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online
